cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles SSE of Port O’Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest to north-northwest toward the central Texas coast, aiming for the Corpus Christi–Port O’Connor area
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near or just northeast of Corpus Christi (Rockport/Port O’Connor vicinity)

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch (also under Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass; Storm Surge Watch from Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island, including Corpus Christi and Matagorda Bays
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (39–73 mph) possible Friday, with a chance of hurricane-force gusts Friday night if intensification continues.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation 4–6 ft above ground level along Corpus Christi Bay and adjacent barrier islands, accompanied by large, destructive waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches with isolated totals near 20 inches possible, producing life-threatening flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged flooding risk due to very slow storm motion that could keep port operations disrupted for several days.
